context.decision_reason: Priority tier: core_flow + features. CODE_QUALITY_AUDIT (round 12) found 20 real findings including 2 CRITICAL: (1) checkoutProduction.js line 19 trusts client-supplied price in Stripe — price manipulation bypass (checkout.js was fixed but NOT checkoutProduction.js — this is a live revenue risk); (2) orderService.js line 70 updateOrderStatus() builds SQL from unsanitized Object.keys — SQL injection vector. Plus 4 HIGH: in-memory download tokens lost on restart, digital delivery error swallowing in checkoutMixed.js, NFT fake IPFS hashes on error, hardcoded fake conversion rate in adminRoutes. All 35 previous tasks (001-035) are completed (verified by review_audit at 100% score). TASK_SYNTHESIZER should read code_quality_audit_output.json and create focused fix tasks for critical and high findings first.
context.what_you_learned: CODE_QUALITY_AUDIT found 20 actionable findings (2 critical, 4 high, 8 medium, 6 low). The decision_log round 12 shows 'unproductive (findings=0)' but this is a stale counter — the actual audit output clearly has substantial findings that have not been synthesized into tasks. All 35 prior tasks (001-035) are status: completed. The LAST_MILE_TEST NO_GO verdict is invalid — tests ran against opensource.org not teneo-marketplace. The critical price bypass in checkoutProduction.js is a direct revenue risk: customers can pay $0.01 for any product by crafting the request body.

top_critical: checkoutProduction.js line 19: client-supplied price used directly in Stripe — price manipulation (checkout.js was fixed but not checkoutProduction.js)
orderService.js line 70: updateOrderStatus() SQL built from unsanitized Object.keys — SQL injection risk
